function_call.name: classify_risks
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Inadequate ventilation leading to poor indoor air quality and increased risk of disease transmission.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High occupancy density leading to increased risk of disease spread and infection.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient cleaning and sanitation leading to microbial contamination and disease transmission through fomites objects or surfaces .","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Imbalance between supply and demand in thermal environment control","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Overheating in the cold zone during winter","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Insufficient heating in the hscw zone during winter","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Continuous monitoring of indoor thermal performance throughout the year may increase the risk of spreading contagious diseases within the building.","category":"Mental health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation in the hospital building may lead to high CO2 concentrations, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Elevated PM 2.5 concentrations in the hospital building may indicate poor indoor air quality, posing health risks to occupants.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Thermal discomfort in the offices may lead to reduced productivity and occupant dissatisfaction.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation leading to high CO2 concentrations in inpatient wards","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Insufficient air purification leading to high PM2.5 concentrations in various hospital areas","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Correlations between subjective and objective IEQ data","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Building occupants’ satisfaction and demands on IEQ parameters are not studied under natural conditions.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Indoor air and CO2 concentration affect occupant satisfaction.","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Differences in climate and HVAC systems between northern and southern China affect thermal experiences and preferences.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Weak acceptance of cooler conditions in the northern group","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Overcooling problem in buildings in northern China","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Narrow range of adaptation to thermal environment in winter for occupants in northern China","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Differences in air quality satisfaction due to ventilation types in buildings in China","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Occupants may consider air quality unacceptable regardless of objective performance, leading to dissatisfaction and potential health risks.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lower acceptance for high CO2 concentrations in building type A compared to building type B, leading to potential dissatisfaction and discomfort for occupants.","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Comparison of different IEQ monitoring tools and systems, which may result in the adoption of suboptimal systems and inadequate IEQ management.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited sensor diversity in IBEM may lead to incomplete monitoring of IEQ parameters and potential health risks.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of sensor customization and flexibility in IBEM limits its adaptability to different IEQ monitoring scenarios.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited data flow and feedback interaction in IBEM may hinder real-time adjustment of environmental parameters based on occupants’ needs and preferences.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of scientific and simplified deployment scheme for IBEM","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Automatic linkage of IBEM with environmental control system","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Transformation of IBEM deployment methodology from experience-based model to data-driven model","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Contamination of the IBEM hardware instrument with contagious pathogens or microbes","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate data security for the extensive IEQ database","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inaccurate or misleading IEQ data collection and transmission","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"The spread of COVID-19 due to physical interaction and lack of lockdown measures","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of occupant presence and actions on building energy use","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High energy use in unoccupied buildings","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Energy performance gap in buildings","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of research on actual energy performance of buildings","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Unoccupied buildings may still consume energy, leading to wastage and increased costs","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Higher ventilation rates required for occupants’ safety may lead to increased energy use","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Close collaboration and physical interaction between municipal staff, researchers, and project partners may increase the risk of contagious disease spread.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Spread of contagious diseases due to close interaction during communication between municipality and electric utility company","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of structured information leading to inefficiency in data analysis and management","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Risk of cross-contamination and disease transmission through close contact with public infrastructure such as public lighting and traffic lights","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High energy consumption by public lighting and other systems","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential impact of social distancing measures on service energy consumption","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited impact of lockdown measures on energy use by systems","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential spread of COVID-19 due to unusual occupation of social assistance buildings and community centers during the pandemic.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased energy consumption in municipal buildings due to the shift to work-from-home policies during the lockdown.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Pandemic outbreak of coronavirus","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Nearly unoccupied municipal buildings, elementary schools, and nursery schools","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"}]}
